businessProfile.name: Roma's Italian Restaurant in The Colony, TX
businessProfile.address: 6700 Main St, The Colony, TX 75056, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 6700 Main St, The Colony, TX 75056, USA

reviews.text: *Delivery* We were so excited because the menu descriptions sounded great but when the food arrived, it was bland and subpar. We ordered the Chicken Picatta and the Chicken Francese. I had to add seasonings to try and save the dish but I ended up only eating 1/2 due to hunger and my husband took a couple bites and stopped. Not worth the $40 we spent and unfortunately won‚Äôt be back.

We ordered Roma's takeout and thought we were getting Little Elm but we got this and it is definitely not anywhere near as good as the Little Elm one. The Chicken Genovese tasted like fish, the bread is stale and tastes awful (I didn't know bread could taste that bad). And the cheese sticks look frozen and have zero flavor. We will never make the mistake of ordering from here again.

We've driven past Roma's hundreds of times and never knew what we were missing!

We had a chance for a date night and decided to try it out. It did NOT disappoint! The reviews are accurate in that the house made salad dressing was good enough to drink. The pink sauce is to die for on any entree.

We got the pasta sampler and a calzone. Both were amazing! The portions are huge and we can't wait to enjoy a nice lunch. The garlic knots were a nice treat as well!

Max informed us that Roma's has been in The Colony for 23 years. He was a gracious host! We can't wait to visit again!
Just went here tonight. It's a quaint neighborhood Italian place with some yummy food. Really enjoyed the fried mushrooms, antipasto salad, and rigatoni. Kiddo really enjoyed the complimentary bread.

I love this place. I have been eating here with my mom as long as it has been open. My favorite dish is the judge's special seen in the picture. All the other food is standard Italian fair. When they ask if you want salad pass on it. It doesn't come with the meal and is not much of a salad. There is always classic Italian music as well wich I enjoy.

editorial_summary.overview: Classic baked ziti, spaghetti & veal dishes are served in a laid-back storefront with booths.

recentReviews.author: Hotwheelz Suz
recentReviews.text: We ordered Roma's takeout and thought we were getting Little Elm but we got this and it is definitely not anywhere near as good as the Little Elm one. The Chicken Genovese tasted like fish, the bread is stale and tastes awful (I didn't know bread could taste that bad). And the cheese sticks look frozen and have zero flavor. We will never make the mistake of ordering from here again.

recentReviews.author: Natalie Holloway
recentReviews.text: *Delivery* We were so excited because the menu descriptions sounded great but when the food arrived, it was bland and subpar. We ordered the Chicken Picatta and the Chicken Francese. I had to add seasonings to try and save the dish but I ended up only eating 1/2 due to hunger and my husband took a couple bites and stopped. Not worth the $40 we spent and unfortunately won‚Äôt be back.

recentReviews.author: Drew Campbell
recentReviews.text:
We've driven past Roma's hundreds of times and never knew what we were missing!

We had a chance for a date night and decided to try it out. It did NOT disappoint! The reviews are accurate in that the house made salad dressing was good enough to drink. The pink sauce is to die for on any entree.

We got the pasta sampler and a calzone. Both were amazing! The portions are huge and we can't wait to enjoy a nice lunch. The garlic knots were a nice treat as well!

Max informed us that Roma's has been in The Colony for 23 years. He was a gracious host! We can't wait to visit again!

recentReviews.author: Dave Liu
recentReviews.text: Just went here tonight. It's a quaint neighborhood Italian place with some yummy food. Really enjoyed the fried mushrooms, antipasto salad, and rigatoni. Kiddo really enjoyed the complimentary bread.

recentReviews.author: Chuck Boothe
recentReviews.text: I love this place. I have been eating here with my mom as long as it has been open. My favorite dish is the judge's special seen in the picture. All the other food is standard Italian fair. When they ask if you want salad pass on it. It doesn't come with the meal and is not much of a salad. There is always classic Italian music as well wich I enjoy.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.6/5 rating from 5 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about Roma's house-made salad dressing and pink sauce, describing them as exceptional and a must-try. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The restaurant's generous portion sizes and delicious dishes like the pasta sampler and calzone leave customers excited for leftovers, enhancing their dining experience. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this

Roma's has a long-standing presence in the community, with 23 years of service and a welcoming host like Max, making it a beloved neighborhood spot. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews about food quality and taste - review management can address this concern
Poor online visibility and confusion with other locations - SEO services can solve this visibility issue
Competition with other locations perceived as better - social media marketing can improve this area
